adjectives.description: retired (comparative more retired, superlative most retired)

entries.meaning: Secluded from society (of a lifestyle, activity etc.); private, quiet. [from 16th c.]
Of a place: far from civilisation, not able to be easily seen or accessed; secluded. [from 16th c.]
examples: The little stone Saint occupied a retired niche in a side aisle of the old cathedral.

entries.meaning: (of people) Having left employment, especially on reaching pensionable age. [from 16th c.]
examples: The retired workers are a major expense due to their pensions.

entries.meaning: No longer in use or production.
examples: Following Jackie Robinson's success, his uniform number, 42, became a retired number across all major league teams.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of retire
